ruleset.name: Processing Ruleset
ruleset.description: Ruleset with custom rules specific to Processing code. Developed as part of the "The Smell of Poor Design" bachelor research project.

rule.name: DrawingStateChangeRule
rule.message: Do not change global variable {0} from method {1}, {1} is part of the draw sequence.
rule.description: Global variables of the sketch should not be changed from the draw method or methods (indirectly) called from the draw method.

rule.name: DecentralizedEventHandlingRule
rule.message: Do not use global event variable {0} in method {1}, as {1} is not one of the event handling methods.
rule.description: Global event handling variables should only be used inside the specified event handler methods.

rule.name: PixelHardcodeIgnoranceRule
rule.message: Do not use literals for pixels for {0} inside method {1}.
rule.description: Drawing functions should not use pixels, but constants or variables instead.

rule.name: StatelessClassRule
rule.message: Class {0} does not declare any fields. Decide if any of the global variables belong here, or alternatively if these methods belong to some other class.
rule.description: Stateless classes are not allowed. Utility classes with only methods should define their methods in the top class (global scope).

rule.name: LongMethodRule
rule.message: The method {0} is too long, {1} lines of code are counted. The method should be made more efficient, split in multiple methods, or responsibilty should be delegated to other objects/classes.
rule.description: Methods longer than a certain amount of rules (50 by default) should be split into separate method calls.
rule.example: void method() { //Wrong: method is too long. println("T") println("h") println("i") println("s") println("") println("m") println("e") println("t") println("h") println("o") println("d") println("") println("i") println("s") println("") println("w") println("a") println("y") println("") println("t") println("o") println("o") println("") println("l") println("o") println("n") println("g") }

rule.name: LongParameterListRule
rule.message: The method {0} has too many parameters, {1} are counted. The parameters should be merged into objects or the method should be split.
rule.description: Methods should not accept too many parameters.

rule.name: GodClassRule
rule.message: The class {0} has too much responsibility. The program design should be reconsidered.
rule.description: Classes should not become a God Class, e.g. they should not take total responsibility for the whole application.

rule.message: The {0} ''{1}'' seems to be very complex. Consider dividing the work.
You have many class variables/attributes. Check if some could be local, or should be part of a separate object.
It is very uncommon to have an empty constructor. Use it to set the initial values of a new object.
